page.title: 16THE FARMS AROUND PONTESBURY
page.content: The majority of farms are owner occupied and farming has been in the families for up to five generations. Everyone enjoys farming in 1985 although they all work a minimum of 10 hours each day and have little or no hired help, except at harvest time. All of the farmers use chemicals to eradicate pests and the main problems are insects, rodents and parasites on both animals and crops. The average size of the fields is 20 acres and there is only one pond for each 500 acres. The hedgerows are generally maintained with a flail mower although some are grown and then layed in the traditional manner. All the farmers seem concerned about conserving wildlife and either plant trees regularly or leave areas of rough land untouched.
